Class Tile

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.cg04.model.tiles.Tile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlienSupportTile, BatteryTile, EmptyTile, HousingTile, LaserTile, PropulsorTile, ShieldTile, StorageTile, StructuralTile
public abstract class Tile extends Object implements Serializable

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public String getType()
      Returns:
      the type of the tile as a String.

    • getId

      public Integer getId()
      Returns:
      the identifier of the tile as an Integer.

    • getWasInBuffer

      public boolean getWasInBuffer()
      Returns:
      true if the tile was previously in a buffer, false otherwise.

    • setWasInBuffer

      public void setWasInBuffer()
      Sets the state of the tile indicating that it was previously in a buffer.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      the short name of the tile as a String.

    • getTileColor

      public String getTileColor()
      Returns:
      the color of the tile as a String.

    • place

      public void place(Ship ship, int x, int y)
      Places this tile on the specified Ship at the given coordinates.

      This method should be overridden by subclasses to implement specific behavior for updating the ship's properties or resources when this tile is placed.

      Parameters:
      ship - the ship on which this tile is to be placed
      x - the x-coordinate in the ship's tile matrix
      y - the y-coordinate in the ship's tile matrix

    • broken

      public void broken(Ship ship, int x, int y)
      Removes this tile from the specified Ship at the given coordinates.

      This method should be overridden by subclasses to implement specific behavior when the tile is broken, such as updating the ship's state or checking for lost connections.

      Parameters:
      ship - the ship on which this tile is marked as broken
      x - the x-coordinate of this tile in the ship's matrix
      y - the y-coordinate of this tile in the ship's matrix

    • getRotation

      public int getRotation()
      Retrieves the rotation value of the tile.
      Returns:
      the rotation value as an integer.

    • rotate90dx

      public void rotate90dx()
      Rotates the Tile 90 degrees clockwise.

      This method rotates the Tiles connections in a clockwise direction, updating the direction of each connection as follows:

      • UP RIGHT
      • RIGHT DOWN
      • DOWN LEFT
      • LEFT UP

    • rotate180

      public void rotate180()
      Rotates the Tile 180 degrees by performing two 90 degrees clockwise rotations.

    • rotate90sx

      public void rotate90sx()
      Rotates the Tile 90 degrees counterclockwise.

    • getConnection

      public Connection getConnection(Direction dir)
      Retrieves the connection associated with the specified direction.
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction for which the connection is to be retrieved. Must be one of the valid directions defined in the Direction enum.
      Returns:
      The Connection associated with the specified direction.

    • isValidConnection

      public boolean isValidConnection(Direction dir, Tile otherTile)
      Determines whether the connection between this tile and another specified tile is valid based on the given direction and connection types.
      Parameters:
      dir - The direction of the connection to validate.
      otherTile - The tile to which this tile is being compared for a valid connection. If null, the connection is considered valid by default.
      Returns:
      true if the connection is valid, according to the specified direction and the types of connections on both tiles; false otherwise.
